job.title: Vacancies Kitchen Team Leader
job.html_description:
Join our team at the AXA Training Centre and play a vital role in keeping our kitchens running smoothly and efficiently. We’re looking for someone with strong kitchen porter experience. You’ll ensure all catering goods are ordered, received, and distributed accurately and on time — while also supporting with travel packing and loading when needed.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the Head Chef and Front of House Manager in ensuring smooth back-of-house operations.
  • Manage food, chemical, and cleaning stock levels using Procure Wizard, ensuring accurate ordering, storage, and rotation.
  • Oversee food deliveries, storage, and stock control, maintaining full compliance with food safety standards.
  • Lead, rota, and support the kitchen porter team to maintain high hygiene and cleanliness standards across all kitchen areas.
  • Monitor food safety using Navitas systems, ensuring correct temperatures and traceability for all products.
  • Ensure all food hygiene, COSHH, and health & safety policies are consistently met and documented.
  • Process purchase orders, delivery notes, and invoices accurately and on time.
  • Conduct regular stock checks and work with external auditors to ensure accurate stock counts.
  • Assist the Head Chef with supplier management, ensuring approved suppliers meet quality and safety standards.
  • Complete all required paperwork, reports, and compliance checks in line with company policies.
  • Conduct annual performance reviews for direct reports and support team development.

 Essential Requirements

  • Strong experience as a lead kitchen porter/ kitchen assistant, or similar role.
  • Proven stock management skills with attention to accuracy and organisation.
  • Good knowledge of food safety and HACCP procedures.
  • Confident using Microsoft Office and other computer systems.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively with chefs, managers, and colleagues.
  • Positive, professional, and team-focused approach to work.

Why should you apply?

This is a full-time permanent role working 35 hours per week, 5 from 7 days, including evenings and weekends. Your main base will be our AXA Training Centre. 

To reward your hard work and commitment we offer a competitive salary, 25 days holiday (plus 8 bank holidays and the option to purchase up to an additional 5 days) and a contributory pension scheme.

You will have access to our benefits kit bag where you can get high street discounts, and a selection of benefit schemes you can join. There are opportunities to get involved with volunteering through our LFC Foundation to give back to the local community.

job.title: Vacancies Warehouse Assistant, DC Operations Support
job.html_description:
We have an exciting opportunity for an individual to join our Liverpool FC team as a Warehouse Assistant, Troubleshooter located at our distribution centre. 

What will you be doing?

In this role, you will act as a key technical and operational resource across all warehouse functions. You’ll support Supervisors and colleagues by providing hands‑on operational expertise, resolving issues on the floor, and helping maintain smooth operational workflow across the Distribution Centre.

Operational Support

  • Competently perform all warehouse tasks (inbound, picking, packing, replenishment, outbound, returns, and production/personalisation) with efficiency and accuracy.
  • Act as the first point of support when operational issues arise, resolving problems quickly and escalating where appropriate.
  • Provide cover during peak periods, colleague absences, or unexpected operational challenges.

Stock Control & Accuracy

  • Support all stock management activities including scanning, put‑away, picking, cycle counts, and reconciliation.
  • Investigate discrepancies and errors in stock movements, providing solutions or escalating recurring patterns to Supervisors.
  • Assist in periodic inventory counts (PI) and ensure accurate stock records and reporting.
  • Model and support loss‑prevention practices and proper stock‑handling procedures.

Training & Coaching Support

  • Mentor and coach new or less‑experienced warehouse operatives on operational procedures and best practices.
  • Support Supervisors in delivering training on SOPs, systems, equipment use, and safety processes.
  • Share expertise across shifts to help raise overall team capability and confidence.

Support for Supervisors

  • Provide additional operational oversight and support to Supervisors during the shift.
  • Monitor team compliance with SOPs, safety requirements, and quality standards, raising concerns when necessary.
  • Recommend process improvements based on hands‑on operational experience.

Health, Safety & Compliance

  • Ensure full compliance with safety policies, PPE requirements, and safe working practices.
  • Conduct equipment checks and report any basic maintenance needs (FLT, scanners, conveyors, packing equipment).
  • Support investigations into incidents, near‑misses, or safety breaches as required.

Problem Solving & Continuous Improvement

  • Identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and recurring issues in real‑time and recommend improvements.
  • Support Supervisors and Operations Managers with process improvement initiatives.
  • Champion change on the warehouse floor, promoting adoption of new systems, tools or ways of working.

Operational Administration Support

  • Assist with day‑to‑day administrative tasks relating to stock, production documentation, returns, or reporting.
  • Ensure data is accurately captured in WMS/ERP systems in line with site standards.
  • Support ad‑hoc reporting or investigation requests from Supervisors or Operations Managers.

Who are we looking for? 

  • Experience working within a distribution centre
  • Leadership skills and the confidence to support colleagues
  • Strong teamwork ethic and communication skills
  • Retail operations knowledge
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Sound IT knowledge
  • Flexible and adaptive approach to work
  • WMS experience
  • Experience working in an automated or system‑driven environment

Why should you apply?

This is a full‑time permanent position working 35 hours per week, across any five days out of seven, which will include regular weekend working. Your main base will be our Distribution Centre, in Prescot.  

Please note, this vacancy may close early if we receive a high volume of applications, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

To reward your hard work and commitment we offer a competitive salary, 25 days holiday (plus 8 bank holidays and the option to purchase up to an additional 5 days) and access to our benefits kit bag which includes but not limited to:

  • Contributory pension scheme matching up to 5.5%
  • Life Assurance Cover
  • Free financial guidance and mortgage advice
  • Car salary sacrifice scheme for affordable driving
  • Cycle to Work scheme to keep you active
  • Purchase season ticket loans for easier commuting
  • Exclusive shopping discounts & cashback with top retailers
  • Will Writing Service for future planning
  • Employee Assistance Programme for confidential support
  • Medicash Health Cash Plan for everyday healthcare needs
  • Volunteering opportunities to give back to the community
  • Special LFC perks – retail discounts, partner offers, free LFCTV GO access, and priority tickets for matches, events & concerts

…and much more! LFC Benefits.pdf

job.title: Vacancies Casual Kitchen Assistants
job.html_description:
We are looking for experienced Kitchen Assistants to join our casual catering team at Anfield Stadium. You’ll work in our state-of-the-art kitchens alongside our talented and creative chefs, supporting the delivery of first-class food and service on match days and events.

 What will you be doing?

  • Assisting with basic food preparation.
  • Unloading and storing deliveries safely and efficiently.
  • Maintaining cleanliness by emptying bins, sweeping, and mopping floors.
  • Ensuring all kitchen equipment is cleaned and stored correctly.
  • Deep cleaning fridges, storage areas, and other kitchen spaces to maintain hygiene standards.
  • Operating automated dishwashers to clean crockery and utensils used by guests.
  • Supporting with porter duties, ensuring all back-of-house areas are tidy and ready for the next event.

Who are we looking for?

We’re looking for hardworking individuals who thrive in a fast-paced kitchen environment.

Please note you must be 18 or over to be considered for this position.

 You’ll have:

  • Previous experience as a Kitchen Assistant, Kitchen Porter, or in a similar role.
  • A good understanding of manual handling techniques and safe working practices.
  • Experience using a range of kitchen equipment.
  • A positive attitude and a commitment to maintaining high standards of cleanliness and teamwork.

Why should you apply?

This is a casual position, offering variable hours including evenings and weekends on a flexible assignment basis.

job.title: Vacancies Casual Match Day Stewards
job.html_description:
Here at Liverpool Football Club, we are looking for Casual Match Day Stewards to join our team.

As part of the recruitment process, shortlisted candidates will be invited to attend a Group Induction & Interview. During the induction, members of our Safety Team will introduce the role, outline key responsibilities, and provide essential information. This will be followed by individual 121 interviews to assess your suitability for the position.

Please submit your application for the role to be considered for invitation to a Group Induction & Interview session.

What will you be doing in the role?

  • Working as part of a team to provide a safe and secure environment for match day events.
  • Ensuring compliance with stadium regulations, keeping spectators safe and informed.
  • Responding effectively to any incidents of disorder with a calm and focused approach.
  • Offering support and guidance to spectators when needed, ensuring they feel welcome and informed.
  • Conducting personal searches of spectators entering the stadium to maintain security.
  • Documenting and reporting incidents, ensuring clear and accurate records are kept.

We are looking for people who:

  • Have strong communication skills who can confidently engage with supporters, even in challenging situations. 
  • Can handle conflict calmly and professionally.
  • Can write clear reports and possess a basic understanding of conflict management.
  • Are over 18, due to the nature of the role.

If you are someone who can bring experience, calm, and a professional approach to this important role, we would love to hear from you.

By applying for the position of Casual Match Day Steward with Liverpool Football Club, please be aware that this role requires the completion of a Level 2 Certificate in Spectator Safety (as per the Sports Grounds Safety Authority), which must be completed within 12 months from the date of your first induction training.

By submitting your application, you confirm that you can commit to completing the Level 2 Certificate in Spectator Safety within 12 months from your first induction training. As this qualification is essential for the role, if you are unable to complete it within this timeframe, we may not be able to progress your application.

This is a casual position, offering variable hours including evenings and weekends on a flexible assignment basis.

job.title: Vacancies Employability Program Coordinator (US based)
job.html_description:
The LFC Foundation is the official charity of Liverpool Football Club. The Foundation has been delivering employability programs in Liverpool for many years and more recently in the US. This is an exciting opportunity to create and deliver high-quality employability programs to provide life-changing opportunities in the most deprived areas of New York and New Jersey, helping to raise the aspiration and job prospects for all participants.

THE LFC FOUNDATION’S WORKS PROGRAMS

This role will support the development of the LFC Foundation’s flagship international employability programs in New York and New Jersey. Working across all employability programs, including Creative Works, a creative-based skills development program and Soccer Works, a sport-based skills development program, which both develop the employability skills of young people at risk of long-term unemployment.

The Program Coordinator will be responsible for effective delivery of LFC Foundation employability program, taking participants from initial engagement during program delivery, through their mentoring and ultimately supporting their pathway into work experience and eventually meaningful paid employment.

Key Responsibilities

· Design and deliver engaging creative employability sessions that build skills and elevate career aspirations.

· Develop curriculum and collaborate with external partners to meet KPIs.

· Support participant identification and recruitment in coordination with UK-based teams.

· Coordinate program logistics including venues, transportation, meals and accommodations.

· Support the Senior Coordinator in building relationships with existing and new schools and organizations, and assisting with funder reporting.

· Facilitate high-quality work experience placements.

· Work closely with the Impact and Insights team to ensure the monitoring and evaluation framework is carried out effectively.

· Manage risk across employability programmes to ensure the safety and wellbeing of all young people and staff.

· Continually implement quality assurance procedures to ensure consistent delivery of a world-class programme.

· Embed the highest safeguarding standards across all areas of work.

Required Knowledge, Skills & Experience

· Experience planning and delivering creative educational workshops or training sessions.

· Experience working with vulnerable populations.

· Understanding of inclusive, youth-centered work practices.

· Knowledge of youth mentoring models.

· Experience guiding young adults to additional opportunities.

· Strong alignment with LFC Foundation mission and values.

· Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.

· Strong organizational and time-management skills.

· Experience within creative, community, or education settings.

· Knowledge of local industries in New York and/or New Jersey.

Technical Skills

· Safeguarding Young People – Level 1 (or U.S. equivalent).

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

· Experience collecting and managing program data

The role involves work across many locations throughout New York and New Jersey in order to deliver the programme in the community. So, if you enjoy making a difference to real people out in the community, this role is for you!

This is a Fixed Term Contract.

To reward your hard work and commitment we offer a competitive salary, 10 days holiday (plus national US holidays) and a contributory pension scheme. 

You will have access to our benefits kit bag where you can get high street discounts, and a selection of benefit schemes you can join. There are opportunities to get involved with volunteering through our LFC Foundation to give back to the local community.

Please note, this vacancy may close early if we receive a high volume of applications, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

job.html_description:
Liverpool Football Club is seeking confident, professional individuals who are passionate about providing exceptional customer service. As a Casual Hospitality Host, you will play a key role in creating a memorable experience for our guests during match days and events throughout the season.

This role offers the chance to work at one of the world’s most iconic football stadiums, in a supportive and professional team. With casual shifts and complimentary Stagecoach transport on match days. If you have a wealth of experience and a professional, friendly approach, this is a great opportunity to bring your skills to a dynamic environment.

What will you be doing in the role?

  • Conducting ticket checks, bag searches, and security wanding to ensure a safe environment for all guests.
  • Escorting guests to their designated boxes, suites, and tables with professionalism and care.
  • Overseeing guest access at doors, escalators, and lifts to ensure smooth and easy transitions.
  • Collaborating with the management team, stewards, and other safety hosts to ensure efficient operations.

  • Take pride in offering a great service and creating a welcoming environment.
  • Comfortable remaining in one position for extended periods during events.

job.html_description:
Are you a Salesforce Administrator with a passion for driving impactful marketing campaigns and transforming data into powerful insights? We’re looking for an energetic, forward‑thinking individual to join our Marketing team and play a key role in shaping the future of our club’s marketing and sales success.

In this role, you’ll take ownership of the management of our Salesforce environment, technically owning the development of the platform, sending out marketing campaigns and supporting the sales team to ensure that leads and contacts are managed efficiently.

As part of a highly collaborative team, you will support the club’s data and marketing technology capabilities, driving sales lead management, marketing automation, sales process optimisation, and insightful reporting. Your work will directly support our sales and account management teams to achieve ambitious targets in the acquisition and retention of Hospitality and non‑matchday events.

What will you be doing?

• Continue the enhancement of the platform by gathering requirements, investigating and proposing solutions, integrating with new apps and collaborating with third parties.

• Salesforce configuration and maintenance including Flow, fields, page layouts, record types and custom settings.

• Be the first point of contact for all daily system admin, user and access management, telephony management, support and training for all users.

• Collaborate with the wider Customer Marketing team with the planning of campaigns and be responsible for segmenting campaign audiences, testing, execution, and post campaign analysis of all Salesforce email campaigns.

• Use of key technologies, such as marketing automation, to drive efficiency in the sales process ensuring the most effective leads are acquired and prioritised for direct contact by the Sales Team.

• Produce a range of dashboards, reports and insight using existing club and third-party data enrichment to ensure senior management and the Sales Team have the necessary information to drive business decisions.

• Manage data quality within Salesforce, keep a monthly tracker of data quality changes and identify and rectify issues.

• Work with the Hospitality and Legal teams to ensure all products and electronic contracts are created and maintained within Salesforce available for the sales team to send to clients.

• Work with the Senior Manager – Marketing Data Environments to use data to help shape the Hospitality and Events sales and service strategies set by the Sales Director.

Who are we looking for?

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring a strong track record as a Salesforce Administrator and, ideally, hold a Salesforce Administrator certification. You will have hands-on experience delivering marketing campaigns in a B2B or B2C environment and be highly numerate, with advanced Microsoft Excel skills.

With a logical and analytical mindset, you’ll be confident working with large datasets, able to manipulate, segment, analyse and translate complex information into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.

You will have excellent organisational and prioritisation skills, with the ability to work accurately under pressure and to tight deadlines. Strong interpersonal skills are essential, and you’ll thrive in a fast-paced marketing and sales environment. You’ll be equally comfortable working collaboratively as part of a team or independently.

This is a full-time perm position working 35 hours per week. Your main base will be our city centre office in Liverpool.

job.html_description:

As a Manager within the Partnerships Operations team, you will provide strategic direction and operational leadership across all partnership delivery activity. The role spans multiple LFC sites, including Anfield, St Helens Stadium, and the AXA Melwood Training Centre.

Operating at both a strategic and hands-on level, the post holder ensures the seamless execution of branding, activation, and event delivery across all venues. Acting as the central coordination point between the Partnership Delivery team and wider club stakeholders, the Partnership Operations Manager ensures that all partnership rights are delivered to the highest standard aligned with club values and reflective of a world‑class global sports organisation.

Multi- Site Operational Leadership 

  • Day to Day operational readiness across - Anfield, St Helens and AXA Melwood.

  • Act as a senior escalation point for operational challenges, driving resolution and continuous improvement across sites.

  • Oversee contractor management, risk assessments, and method statements. 
  • Lead partnership operational contact for any adhoc matches held at Anfield eg Play On pitch. 
  • Oversee all partner related events, private hire or activity across all venues.

  • Mentor the Senior Executive across operational delivery areas, providing strategic direction and professional development support 
  • Promote a positive and collaborative team culture 

Who are we looking for? 

The ideal candidate will hold a bachelor’s degree and bring proven experience in commercial partnerships, sponsorship operations, or similar roles within the sports or media industry. They will demonstrate strong project management capability, with the ability to prioritise effectively, manage timelines, and coordinate multiple stakeholders. Excellent leadership, organisational skills, and meticulous attention to detail are essential to ensure accuracy and consistency across operational processes and contract management. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are also key, enabling effective collaboration and relationship-building with both internal teams and external partners.

job.title: Vacancies In-House Employment Lawyer
job.html_description:
In-House Employment Lawyer

We have an exciting opportunity for an individual to join our Liverpool FC, in-house Legal team. We’re looking for an individual with expert commercial employment lawyer to provide pragmatic, timely advice across the Club, helping to ensure our people practices, decision making and policies comply with employment legislation, data protection requirements and international employment standards.

In this high volume, fast paced environment, you’ll report to the Vice President, Legal and partner closely with the People & Culture team, offering hands on case management., and proactive legal insight to minimise risk and strengthen internal capability. 

You will be expected to handle complex ER casework, DSARs, contractual queries and global employment issues. 

What will you be doing?

Employment Law Advise 

  • Provide expert, commercially focused employment law advice to leaders and People & Culture teams and business leaders.. 
  • Advise across all areas of UK employment law, 
  • Monitor developments in employment legislation and ensure the Club remains compliant and future‑ready. 
  • Produce clear legal guidance, risk assessments and recommended options. 

Complex Case Management 

  • Lead ER cases
